1123306529262850053.text: , but how? Steven Clarke, Deputy Associate Administrator for Exploration, dives into the details of making #Moon2024 a reality in this new episode of our #GravityAssist Podcast: Buying a Ride to the Moon Through Commercial Partnerships. Strap in: https://go.nasa.gov/2PCC9pz pic.twitter.com/p2nKdg5ORl

1123064120104837122.text: This week, as part of the #PlanetaryDefense conference, @NASA and other agencies are participating in a hypothetical asteroid risk exercise. This is an #ExerciseOnly. Information about the simulated asteroid "threat" is at https://go.nasa.gov/2GTzJAk .

1123302717244329984.text: Day 2 of the #PlanetaryDefense asteroid exercise is underway. This #ExerciseOnly simulates an asteroid threat to which agencies plan a response. You can read the Day 2 update here: https://go.nasa.gov/2IVXUz9  or watch the tabletop exercise live athttps://go.nasa.gov/2UTTuLv

1123306532958031872.text: Last November, we held a workshop with a goal of fostering diversity in leadership roles on #NASAScience missions. Based on feedback, we identified actions we’re going to implement, & one of them is this new website. Take a look & let us know your thoughts https://go.nasa.gov/2PGSv0y pic.twitter.com/DH4Q7U2hcz

1122089553282646016.text: Hi @AstroSamantha, and #HappyBirthday! There are not many smarter, more inspiring, and more dedicated people I have met during my travels. Thanks for your work on behalf of science and exploration! BTW - I bumped into your picture multiple times yesterday at @Schiphol #allthebesthttps://twitter.com/esa_history/status/1121663163378757632 …

1121518971239436288.text: Ever wonder how NASA identifies, monitors & studies near-Earth asteroids & comets? Next week, experts from around the world will gather at the #PlanetaryDefense conference to discuss the latest research on these objects & you can watch via live stream: https://go.nasa.gov/2GCf8yN  1/2pic.twitter.com/cpF9hgleEQ

1123182435347369985.text: I always wondered how bright the night sky would be when observing from the inside of a globular cluster. There are so many star, so closely together. Well, here is a simulation - check it out: https://www.google.com/amp/s/io9.gizmodo.com/what-the-night-sky-would-look-like-from-inside-a-globul-1589324556/amp …https://twitter.com/nasa/status/1122517076130914304 …

1121429379102466048.text: I really like this website,  #SpaceforUs: research funded through @NASAEarth has impact in each of our lives, whether we are aware of it or not. This site will make these connections!https://twitter.com/nasaearth/status/1121427756275904512 …

1121794216357556229.text: From space, @NASAEarth missions see our changing planet over time. Some of these effects are related to climate change, some are not. Some document the effects of urbanization, or the ravage of natural hazards. All show our planet in a state of flux. Look: https://go.nasa.gov/2GEWRAS pic.twitter.com/ghbki07tkI

1123330184034291717.text: Asteroid researchers on Earth will soon gain a powerful new way to remotely conduct experiments aboard @Space_Station. The device will help study how samples of simulated asteroid particles behave in microgravity & the vacuum of space. More @ISS_Research: https://go.nasa.gov/2vwb9yO pic.twitter.com/wjKk0MncHP

1122811168417026049.text: Having coffee with @Ch_Franzen, and two originals from my home-town, Heiligenschwendi. I always love to learn about the values and thought-process of my childhood environment. It has been nearly 30 years since I last lived there, but things still feel familiar...pic.twitter.com/bFQXf5HIsD

1123375000919134210.text: On April 29, 1999, @NASAEarth Observatory started delivering science stories and imagery to the public through the Internet. See what they have in store to celebrate their 20th anniversary: https://go.nasa.gov/2vwaFZw pic.twitter.com/fGCk5JSwGJ

1122231403360473089.text: The universe is getting bigger every second. But how fast is the universe expanding? As @NASAHubble and other telescopes seek to answer this question, they have run into an intriguing difference between what scientists predict and what they observe: https://go.nasa.gov/2GCdbma pic.twitter.com/jhKn9MlWFn

1121523969306263556.text: I am at the airport heading to Switzerland to attend the funeral of my mother Hildi Zurbuchen who passed away last Saturday. She was a strong and caring woman dedicating her life to family and church. Even though we lived far away from each other for decades, we will miss her!pic.twitter.com/351NbGTISB – at Washington Dulles International Airport (IAD)

1123306621055176705.text: We’re also working to develop info sessions & workshops for prospective future mission leaders. We’re aiming to make these free to attend & plan to hold them in multiple locations. To subscribe to the mailing list & learn about these opportunities, visit: https://lists.hq.nasa.gov/mailman/listinfo/hq-smdpi-workshop-outreach …

1121242313622159362.text: Thanks @cboldenjr for flying this exiting mission to its destination. @NASAHubble remains the most prolific discovery machine in the NASA Science inventory!https://twitter.com/NASAHubble/status/1121051785358204928 …

1121519753355460614.text: #ExerciseOnly: Experts will also simulate a fictional asteroid impact scenario to help inform involved players of important aspects of a possible disaster & identify issues for accomplishing a successful response. More on the #PlanetaryDefense exercise https://go.nasa.gov/2ILpVdE  2/2pic.twitter.com/SfThuTMl58

1122603898043236355.text: Tomorrow, Administrator @JimBridenstine will deliver the #PlanetaryDefense conference keynote at 9:20am ET. Watch for the latest on how NASA & its partners scan the skies for asteroids & comets that orbit the Sun within 30 million miles of Earth’s orbit: https://go.nasa.gov/2GEflSa pic.twitter.com/aufEug5cJB
